thread.title: Rick Pitino had to be held back from furiously confronting a UNC fan | For The Win
thread.title_full: Rick Pitino had to be held back from furiously confronting a UNC fan | For The Win

author: Andrew Joseph
title: Rick Pitino had to be held back from furiously confronting a UNC fan | For The Win
text:
Rick Pitino had to be held back from furiously confronting a UNC fan Rick Pitino had to be held back from furiously confronting a UNC fan By Andrew Joseph February 22, 2017 10:07 pm Follow @andyj0seph shares 
Louisville went into the locker room down 3 to North Carolina at halftime on Wednesday night, and Rick Pitino was not pleased. 
It just didn’t appear to have anything to do with the game. 
Sports Illustrated NFL writer Jonathan Jones was in attendance at the Dean Smith Center and captured video of a furious confrontation involving Pitino and a UNC fan. The Louisville head coach had to be physically restrained and guided through the tunnel. Rick Pitino is very displeased with a UNC fan pic.twitter.com/z4bYUuyMw6 
— Jonathan Jones (@jjones9) February 23, 2017 
It was unclear what was said to Pitino, but when Louisville returned for the second half, police officers walked along with them. U of L support staff just came out with UNC staff and the cops in the corner of the stands where fans/Pitino exchanged words. 
— Jeff Greer (@jeffgreer_cj) February 23, 2017 
This incident near the UNC student section came one day after Kentucky coach John Calipari walked out of an interview amid heckling chants from the Mizzou student section. More NCAAB!
